page.title: 09BLACKMORE VALE DAIRY FARMING
page.content: The large dairy farm due west of this area covers the excellent grazing land with a large herd of Friesians and its followers.The arable fields have good crops of wheat and barley and 2 or 3 cuts of silage grass.Some hay is made for winter fodder. In the south a former old mill has been converted to a modern house with a fertile cultivated garden alongside the Bibbern Brook.Ten acres of rough grazing support 20 young beef cattle. Birds and insects,particularly dragon- flies are plentiful by the brook.Few big trees are noted here but rabbits foxes,stoats and a few pheasants are observed. The only amenity in this area is a hard surfaced road but no bus service. There are only 4 isolated houses.The occupants work on the land or are retired.There are no children.
